protein.specific_function: Responsible for the deiodination of T4 (3,5,3',5'-tetraiodothyronine) into T3 (3,5,3'-triiodothyronine). Essential for providing the brain with appropriate levels of T3 during the critical period of development.

reference.reference_text: Croteau W, Davey JC, Galton VA, St Germain DL: Cloning of the mammalian type II iodothyronine deiodinase. A selenoprotein differentially expressed and regulated in human and rat brain and other tissues. J Clin Invest. 1996 Jul 15;98(2):405-17.

Buettner C, Harney JW, Larsen PR: The 3'-untranslated region of human type 2 iodothyronine deiodinase mRNA contains a functional selenocysteine insertion sequence element. J Biol Chem. 1998 Dec 11;273(50):33374-8.
Ohba K, Yoshioka T, Muraki T: Identification of two novel splicing variants of human type II iodothyronine deiodinase mRNA. Mol Cell Endocrinol. 2001 Feb 14;172(1-2):169-75.
